The civil war had just ended, and all tribes were extremely poor. This time, a large number of experts and elites from the tribes were mobilized to set traps, and all tribes contributed a lot of materials.

If this continues, it will be equivalent to supporting a group of unemployed soldiers, and all ethnic groups will face great economic pressure.

"Your Majesty, there is no need to worry too much. Our plan is an open conspiracy. As long as the Alpha Kingdom wants to solve the border problem, it will not miss this opportunity.

Just wait patiently. Hudson likes to take people by surprise. Maybe they are already hiding in some corner of the grassland, waiting for the opportunity to strike.

According to the news we released, the Holy Land of Heritage will be born in five days. They can't keep dragging it on.

Maybe tomorrow, maybe the day after tomorrow, or maybe right now, they have already started!"

As he spoke, the Eagle King suddenly had a bad premonition, as if a disaster was about to happen, but he couldn't tell what it was.

"Did the plan fail?"

The worries deep inside were directly reflected on his face. He was trying to persuade others, but he ended up making himself depressed.

...

As night fell, Hudson and his group, led by six powerful saints, dispersed around the Eagle Royal Court.

As for Hudson, he brought a group of magicians and rode a giant dragon, appearing above the Eagleman Royal Court.

"Get started!"

Following Hudson's order, a group of magicians who had been prepared poured their magic directly downwards.

The originally dark night was suddenly broken into silence. After receiving the signal to act, the assault teams lying in ambush all around also took action.

"Enemy attack!"

The sentinel's cry with his life was undoubtedly in vain. The mighty magic attack in the sky continued, and anyone who was not a fool would know that the enemy attack continued.

In an instant, the Eagle camp turned into a sea of fire.

"The enemy magician is in the sky, quickly take off to intercept him..."

Without waiting for the middle-aged eagle man to finish his words, he went to see the Beast God in a confused manner.

When a group of powerful men from the Holy Land put aside their pride and turned into assassins, the tragedy of the Eagle General was already doomed.

However, the Eagleman officer's order was still delivered. Countless Eaglemen began to take off, trying to eliminate the magician who posed the greatest threat.

Unfortunately, they were unlucky. As soon as they flew up, they suddenly felt their bodies sinking, as if a big hand was pulling them down, and then they heard the sound of thumps landing on the ground.

Countless Eagle men, before they knew what was happening, were turned into shells and launched a suicide attack on their own camp.

"Gravity field!"

An old Eagle man with considerable strength recognized Bear Stearns's innate magical power and quickly spoke up to remind him:

"Be careful, the enemy's Saint Domain warriors are taking action!"

As soon as he finished speaking, a blazing flame enveloped him. He tried to pull away to avoid it, but he was in the gravity field and his wings broke as soon as he moved.

An instinctive pause in his body turned him into a huge fireball. He only had time to let out a scream before he fell directly to the ground, hitting the heads of two fleeing eagle men.

Thanks to the extra cushion, the old eagle man did not die immediately, but this was just the beginning of the tragedy.

Watching himself being roasted and the aroma of meat filling his nostrils became the final torment at the end of his life.

There was no way out. Being targeted by the two sacred beasts, the dragon and the bear, at the same time doomed him to tragedy.

Similar unlucky guys keep appearing on the battlefield.

At this moment, Hudson was like a strategic bomber pilot, commanding Maxim to move around the battlefield, while the magicians on the dragon's back took turns to serve as fire output.

Wherever there are many Eagle People, you can see them, constantly harvesting Eagle People.

The battle below also entered a white-hot stage. From the sky to the ground, there were battlefields everywhere.

"High Priest, the Imperial Court has been attacked by the enemy, please..."

Before he could finish his words, the middle-aged eagle man suddenly realized something was wrong and exclaimed in panic, "You are not the high priest, who are you?"

Unfortunately, no one answered this question. All he was greeted with was a look, and then the middle-aged eagle man's eyes lost their light, and it was obvious that he had lost his mind.

"Little Eagle, tell me what year it is now?

Who is the current overlord of the continent?

Who are the enemies outside?

..."

A series of questions came from the strange man's mouth, and the middle-aged eagle man just answered instinctively.

"Year 99996 of the Holy Calendar!

Humanity!

Humanity!

..."

After answering the questions, the weirdo who understood the situation sighed secretly and muttered in a voice that only he could hear:

"Another ten thousand years has passed, and I won't lose again this time!

Judging from the movements, there should be more than one Saint outside. This body can only carry limited power, and if it encounters them, it will probably not be a match.

It seems that I have no choice but to give up this identity and find another place to settle down.

Lillian, wait for me..."

As he spoke, the strange man pointed his finger, and a hole appeared on the forehead of the middle-aged eagle man in a trance.

As if feeling unsafe, he immediately gave the Eagle Man another blow, directly slapping his head off.
Chapter 527:
Chapter 207: Grassland Tremor

The killing continued, the blood reflected the raging fire, mixed with the cries and shouts of killing, playing a different kind of music, telling of the cruelty of war.

The Eagleman Imperial Court, which was internally empty and failed to organize an effective counterattack in the first place, was doomed to a tragic ending.

The smart Eagle Man has taken advantage of the chaos to break out to the outside world.

Although Hudson and his crew were all experts, their numbers were too small to stop all the Eaglemen, so they simply let them leave.

Once the precedent of running away was set, it could no longer be stopped. Finding it hopeless to win, more and more Eagles joined the escape team, leaving only a group of Eagle leaders roaring in place.

This roar did not last long. There is always a price to pay for being in the limelight. The more noisy you are, the faster you will die.

The Eagle Masters who stayed behind in the Imperial Court launched several attempts to block the attack, but the gap in strength between the two sides was too great. Almost as soon as they met, they suffered heavy losses.

There is no way. The population base of the Eagle People is limited, and the number of masters born accordingly is not large, and they are scattered all over the place.

The one-sided battle quickly broke down the psychological defenses of the Eagles. Everyone was desperately fleeing, not even caring about their families.

The more you flee, the more efficient your killing will be. Leaving your back to the enemy on the battlefield is the biggest mistake.

The racial war was cruel, and no one spared the foreign race. Only the dead Eagle Man was a good Eagle Man.

The killing in the dark night seemed to shake the heavens. A blood moon slowly rose, filling the atmosphere with sadness.

As time passed, the battle gradually came to an end and the team began to collect the spoils.

As the royal family of the orcs, the Eaglemen still have a lot of wealth, but unfortunately they came here for a sneak attack and couldn't take away too much spoils.

Maxim was the most eager to grab the treasures, and he swallowed them all at once. If Hudson hadn't stopped him in time, he would have been unwilling to let go of even the copper coins.

Of course, this is limited to this. Once you see the gold coins, you will be merciless, even Hudson's face will not be useful.

No one competes with the dragon for spoils. Everyone is only interested in magic equipment and rare treasures. There is really no place to store gold coins!

Only a handful of people have space rings, and their capacity is very limited.

As a result, a large amount of cash fell into the hands of Maxim and Bear Stearns, which made Hudson jealous.

Others thought that he was proud of his status and didn't want to participate in the fight for the spoils. But in fact, only Hudson himself knew that he had no chance of winning!

Unless he gets off Maxim and acts alone, there's no hope of gaining anything given Hudson's speed.

Safety is above all else. Hudson, who still has some sanity left, decisively gave up on this suicidal approach.

The battle was indeed coming to an end, but there were still many lone Eagle men. If he was attacked by surprise, he might not be able to survive.

"Dear Mr. Maxim, we have almost finished searching here, and we need to go to the next stop.

If it's too late, the Eagle Man will run away with the treasure!"

Hudson began to persuade.

This operation was not free work. Although the kingdom could not afford to pay the workers, the looted spoils would belong to whoever got them first.

However, everyone came here to fight the orcs, and had never thought about how to collect the spoils beforehand. Only Maxim and Bear Stearns were lured by the spoils.

Join a team with the kingdom to rob, all the spoils belong to you, and the hatred is borne by the Alpha Kingdom. It is a happy time in the life of a dragon or a bear.

After taking a lingering look at the battlefield and grabbing a claw, Maxim reluctantly returned to the team.

Looking at the bags that were so unpresentable, Hudson's mouth twitched. If he recorded this scene with a photo stone, he would be able to sell it for a good price later.

"The message has been delivered, and we must hurry to the next Eagle Tribe.

If you consume too much energy, just let me know. The magic potion I prepared here can instantly restore you to your peak condition!

You can rest assured that these medicines have no side effects and all you need to do is get some sleep afterwards.

No charge!"

Hudson said in a pretentious manner.

As the most famous magic potion master in the entire continent, Hudson can be regarded as a unique school in the field of magic potions. The only problem is that he lacks disciples to help him strengthen his influence.

However, this does not affect the spread of the reputation of Ha's magic potion on the mainland. After several years of fermentation, everyone can accept it even if the efficacy of the potion is a little bit beyond belief.

When they heard about free sponsorship, everyone's faces changed, especially the people in the kingdom, who looked at Hudson in a superior manner.

Potions that replenished mana were always extremely expensive, and potions that could instantly restore a person to peak condition were even more legendary.

This is no longer a question of money. A bottle of medicine like this can save lives at a critical moment.

On the battlefield, no one dared to give their all, mainly because they were worried that their output would be too high and they would not be able to hold on until the end of the battle.

If there were instant recovery potions, it would be completely different. Especially for the Saint Domain masters, if they had no worries, they would even dare to cast forbidden spells.

"Don't look at me like that. Magic potions are good, but they are not without limitations.

Although it is theoretically possible to take medicine continuously to force yourself back to peak condition, it puts too much pressure on the body.

The knight's situation is better. If the magician's magic power is completely exhausted, he can only recover twice at most.

If there are more, I can't guarantee any side effects."

Hudson's explanation not only failed to dampen everyone's enthusiasm, but made them even more enthusiastic.

It is normal to have restrictions. If there were no impact at all, people would be afraid to use it.

Deep down, everyone has made up their minds that no matter what the price, they must order a batch later.

This thing is really useful on the battlefield. It can restore the peak after the magic power is exhausted, which is equivalent to adding a top-level strongman in some situations.

"Marshal, being able to recover twice is more than enough. We are here to launch a sneak attack this time, and there is no need to engage in a head-on battle with the enemy!"

Archbishop Terran said with a smile.

At this moment, he had a particularly good impression of Hudson. It was as if the label of "arrogant and domineering" was suddenly removed.

As a member of the royal family, there are a set of standards for behavior. To judge whether a person is loyal, just look at what he does.

There is no doubt that Hudson always keeps the overall situation in mind when doing specific things.

No matter how you look at it, he is a loyal subject of the kingdom.

As for "arrogant and domineering", that was simply a label shared by all the ministers. It originally belonged to the five great dukes of the North, but now it fell on Hudson.

This was inevitable if one wanted to get things done. He had to veto the king's orders a few times and deal with a few restless nobles, and then he would be punished.

Unlike the five dukes of the North, Hudson's personal image was much better. Although the royal family members naturally hated powerful officials, it did not affect Hudson from becoming their partner.

In the past few collaborations, the royal family has profited, which directly reduced everyone's disgust towards Hudson.

No one hesitated, and they all took the medicine from Hudson. Whether to use it or not depends on the actual situation, but you can't be without it.

Influenced by this good news, even the sadness caused by the death of companions in battle was alleviated a lot.

Life and death are inevitable on the battlefield. Even if they have the upper hand, there are still four unlucky guys who were dragged down by the Eagle Master.

Compared to death, injury is nothing.

There is a sanctuary priest in the team, and he is holding a divine weapon in his hand. As long as he is still alive, he can pull people back from the brink of death.

As for how much life span would be reduced, Hudson didn't care. Anyway, as long as the person was revived with full health and did not affect the subsequent battle, it would be fine.

After selecting a precious spot, digging a hole, and burying the bodies of their comrades, the team started a new journey.

...

Three hundred miles away, inside a large Eagle Tribe camp.

"What about the Imperial Court being attacked by the Alpha Kingdom?"

Chief Palmer asked in horror.

The location of the Imperial Court is in the heart of the Orc Empire, and there are several Eagle Tribes guarding nearby. Under normal circumstances, they would not fail to give warnings if the enemy came.

"Yes, Chief Palmer.

The Imperial Court was indeed attacked by masters of the Alpha Kingdom, led by the great demon Hudson. Even if he turned into ashes, I would still recognize him!"

The old eagle man said murderously.

If possible, he wouldn't mind turning Hudson into ashes. There were many orcs who had similar ideas, but they were just thinking about it.

If they really encountered it, everyone's first reaction would be panic. The figures of Maxim and Bear Stearns became the nightmare of countless orcs.

"impossible!

The Imperial Court is heavily guarded, and it is not something that a few human masters can shake. No matter how powerful Hudson is, he can't beat the tens of thousands of guards of the Imperial Court..."

As he was talking, Chief Palmer suddenly realized something was wrong. It seemed that the Eagle Court was not as strictly guarded as before.

In order to ambush the human race, the Eagle King not only drew experts from various tribes, but also took away the most elite Royal Guard Corps.

"Chief Palmer, as emotionally difficult as it is to accept, it is the truth.

This time, the enemy has dispatched many Saint Domain experts, as well as hundreds of seventh- and eighth-level experts. Even if all the Imperial Guards were there, they might not be able to stop them.

Speed is of the essence in war, you should quickly order reinforcements to the Imperial Court!"

After listening to the old Eagle man's explanation, Chief Palmer's face became even gloomier.

The Alpha Kingdom's massive move at one time clearly shows its intention to destroy the Eagleman Royal Court.

Under normal circumstances, such an expedition would be difficult to succeed. But with the dragon knight, everything is different.

With the size of a dragon, it can easily lead a team of several hundred people. With the protection of the Holy Land magician, it is not difficult to hide from their detection.

In fact, even if the tribe ahead discovered the enemy attack, it would be useless. The speed of transmitting information is difficult to be faster than the speed of the dragon's movement.

When you encounter a creature like this that travels thousands of miles a day, the news will become old news by the time it is passed back.

"Pass the order down, assemble a team to rescue the emperor..."

"Enemy attack!"

Before he could finish his words, he was interrupted by this harsh voice. A rain of fire had already fallen from the sky, and even Chief Palmer's tent was on fire.

"Guards, quickly notify the captains and organize people to fight back!"

Chief Palmer gave the order hastily.

I have no time to put out the fire, let's just defeat the enemy first!

The royal court had just been attacked, and his own family was soon after in misfortune. A sense of foreboding arose in Palmer's heart.

As soon as he stepped out of the tent, reality confirmed this. Maxim's huge body was too recognizable.

"Quickly fetch the Dragon Slayer Spear!"

Chief Palmer gave the order in panic.

There was no chance of luck, the team in front of them was the one that attacked the Imperial Court. If nothing unexpected happened, the Imperial Court would most likely be dead.

"Father, our Dragon Slayer Spear is missing a firing mechanism. I'm afraid..."

His son's reminder brought the enraged Chief Palmer back to reality.

The Dragon Slaying Spear, a product of the last era, has long since disappeared from the stage of history along with the departure of the dragon.

They are only collected for collection purposes, and only a few can be used normally.

Even in the last era, this thing could only threaten dragons, and there were not many cases of successfully slaying dragons.

Maxim has always made a living by his appearance. His size, comparable to that of a dragon king, is enough to dispel the fantasies of all dragon slayers.

Chief Palmer calmed down, with a desperate expression on his face, and immediately ordered his son beside him: "Take the tribal heritage and leave immediately, the farther the better!

Everything is for the continuation of the race!

The enemy came prepared, and we all fell into the trap. After this battle, the status of our Eagle Royal Family will definitely be lost..."

Before he could finish his words, the battle was already upon him.

Obviously, his men did not disappoint Chief Palmer's "expectations" and completed the defeat in the shortest time possible.

There was no way. The imperial court with tens of thousands of soldiers could not stop the enemy, let alone an ordinary eagle tribe.

"Go!"

While urging his son to leave, he raised his spear and rushed forward. Being able to become the leader of the tribe, Palmer was not a weak person.

Unfortunately, his luck was not very good. He directly found a Sanctuary Knight as his opponent. After a brief confrontation, Palmer was knocked away, and the spear in his hand was broken into two pieces.

Reaching out to wipe the blood from the corner of his mouth, Palmer fell to the ground and said with his last bit of strength: "Despicable!"

It was really too much of a bully for a Saint Domain warrior to disguise himself as a seventh-level knight. If he had known that his opponent was so powerful, Palmer would have turned and run.

The old eagle man who came to report the news just now was very smart. His shadow had long disappeared from the battlefield, and he rushed out as soon as he heard about the enemy attack.

Those who didn't know the situation thought he was going to fight, but in fact he was looking for an opportunity to escape.

"childish!"

Perhaps he was deeply moved, or perhaps it was a deliberate prank, but the smiling reply from the old man from the sanctuary made Palmer die with regret.

...

As the survivors fled, news of the attack on the Eagle Royal Court quickly spread across the prairie.

By the time the news reached the Bear People's Royal Court, as many as eight Eagle People tribes had been harmed, and more than 200,000 Eagle People had become victims.

Looking at the intelligence in his hand, the Eagle Emperor couldn't believe it was true. He didn't ambush the enemy, but he lost his hometown first.

The bloody killing is still going on, and it is clear that the enemy is here to destroy the Eagle People.

"reinforce?"

As soon as this thought came to his mind, the Eagle King shed bitter tears.

The Eagle Tribe near the Imperial Court happened to be one of the most powerful tribes among the Eagle Tribe. These elites were wiped out by the enemy, and the Eagle Tribe was no longer able to organize an effective counterattack.

"Everyone, my Eagle People were attacked by the Alpha Kingdom. Now the Royal Court has been lost, and many nearby tribes have been slaughtered.

Please work together to keep this enemy on the prairie!"

The Eagle King said in a firm tone.

Although he knew that it was unreliable to ask for help from allies now, the Eagle People had no choice.

With such heavy losses, it's impossible that they didn't even try to fight back, right?

If no action is taken and the enemy is allowed to continue slaughtering, they will soon disappear from the Orc Steppe.

"Eagle King, I'm afraid we need to think about this matter carefully. The enemy is moving too fast, and our people can't catch up at all.

All the strong men from the Holy Domain have joined the battle. Even if we lock their positions in advance, it will be difficult to keep them.

Ask for help from the Anti-Humanity League!

The Alpha Kingdom violated the rules and used Sanctuary warriors on the battlefield without authorization. We need the Alliance to send Sanctuary warriors to support us!"

The Tiger King suggested slowly.

If he were facing the Eaglemen in their heyday, he would definitely not jump out so quickly to challenge the Eaglemen Emperor's face, but now is different from the past. The current Eaglemen Emperor is only in name only.

Originally, the Eaglemen were the floor of the royal family. If they were not the air force of the Orc Empire, they would not be worthy of this status.

This wave of major losses made it difficult for the main force to avoid falling. It can be said that this change directly broke the political balance that the Orc Empire had just formed.

The four major royal families were able to firmly suppress the seven major royal families. Now that there are only three major royal families, it is hard to say whether they can continue to maintain their strategic advantage.

"snort!"

After giving a cold shout to express his dissatisfaction, the Eagle King sat back in his seat.

It's not that he doesn't want to continue fighting, but the other three emperors who should have stood up to support him chose to remain silent at this moment.

It was obvious that they had made their position clear through silence and agreed with the Tiger King's proposal.

The reason was very cruel, they really couldn't catch up with the enemy. Even if they sent reinforcements, they could only passively take the beating.

In a short period of time, the Orc Empire is unable to stop the attack of the Alpha Kingdom, so the next question is who will be the unlucky one.

It is better for the Eagle People to be beaten than for our own people to be beaten.

The strategic significance of the Air Force is indeed important, but compared with the interests of one's own race, it still has to take a back seat.

Perhaps he felt that this was a bit excessive, so the Bear King slowly said, "Eagle King, it will take time for the alliance to make a decision. We are unable to stop the enemy in a short period of time. Let's quickly order the tribes to disperse!

Gathering together will make it easier for the enemy to kill us, so it is better to break up into smaller groups and avoid being attacked for the time being."

Frankly speaking, this idea is very cowardly and lacks the dominance that royal family should have. However, this is the best choice for Eagle Man at the moment.

It is very difficult for a tribe of tens of thousands of people to migrate without leaving any traces. Even if they move immediately, they can't get far.

If it became a small tribe of a few thousand people, it would be different. Just run in any direction. The prairie is so vast that as long as you are not too unlucky, you will not run into the enemy.

"good!"

The Eagle King replied in a low voice.

At this point, we can only save as many tribes as possible. For the rest, we can only hope for the Alliance.

Deep down, the Eagle King was already deeply annoyed. If he had known that the enemy would not play by the rules, he would not have participated in this unreliable plan to lure the enemy.

If the troops had not been withdrawn, perhaps the Imperial Court headquarters would have been able to hold on and would not have been in the current completely passive situation.
Chapter 528:
Chapter 208: Forbidden Spell

By the stream, Hudson and his team were busy resting and washing up. The days of fighting had made these masters feel physically and mentally exhausted.

Compared to their previous gentleness, everyone was now filled with a strong sense of hostility, which lowered the temperature around them.

As a commander who fought in many battles, Hudson had seen such murderous scenes countless times.

This would happen after every major war. Often, he could roughly judge the results of the battle just by the evil spirits of the soldiers without even looking at the battle reports.

There is no doubt that these evil spirits are not good things. Even if they can deter the enemy's courage, Hudson would rather not have them.

It is common for evil spirits to be so strong that they invade people's brains and cause physical and mental collapse. Hudson had witnessed with his own eyes that soldiers went crazy after a battle.

After the battle, the troops rested, not only to restore physical strength, but also to allow the soldiers to regulate their bodies and minds and get rid of the influence of hostility.

Of course, most soldiers had no problem. Although ordinary soldiers participated in the killing, they did not actually kill many enemies.

The situation this time was obviously different. The entire assault team consisted of only more than 200 people, but they had won hundreds of thousands of battles.

Killing hundreds or thousands of people was commonplace. If the number of Eaglemen killed was less than three digits, it would simply be a drag on the team.

Affected by the evil spirit, everyone became more angry. If there was a slight dispute between comrades, they would start cursing.

Hudson was so exhausted just to mediate the internal conflicts that he had to let the team stop and rest.

"Archbishop Terran, the evil spirit on everyone is very strong now. If it continues for a long time, I am afraid it will affect my character. Is there any way to eliminate it directly?"

Hudson asked with concern.

"Marshal, the problem we have now is not just because of the killing, but also because of the Eagle Man's curse before his death.

In addition to the beast god priests, the Orc Empire also has a mysterious group - the shamans, most of whom have practiced curses.

This kind of evil magic sounds scary, but it is actually not as scary as rumored. It can be regarded as a type of mental attack.

It is said that the conditions for performing these evil spells are very harsh, requiring the preparation of a medium and sacrifices, and also having to bear the corresponding backlash.

In the previous battle, there were shamans. These faint curses were probably cast by them before they died.

Without a medium to guide it, the curse is cast solely through sacrifice. With everyone's strength, we can completely withstand it, and everything will be fine after a few days.

If you want to solve it immediately, you can use purification to cleanse the soul and remove the curse attached to it."

After listening to Archbishop Tyron's explanation, Hudson frowned. The solution was indeed simple, but it was troublesome to implement.

There are still countless orc tribes on the prairie, waiting for them to be redeemed. If they stay for a long time to rest, it will be a waste of fighting opportunities.

The enemy will not stay where they are and wait for them to kill them. Once the news spreads, the orc tribe will most likely choose to migrate.

Once the orcs started moving, it would be difficult to eliminate them in a targeted manner as before. Unless you were extremely unlucky and ran into them, just searching for the target would be a hassle.

Casting the purification spell was not a good choice. This thing was a life-threatening magic, especially when it affected the soul, which was a big taboo.

Even if the king were here, he couldn't force everyone to accept it.

"It's up to you whether you want to receive the purification baptism or not! If you feel something is wrong with your body, go find a priest to treat you.

The Eagles have been broken up into small pieces, so there is no point in continuing to track them. Let's stop and rest for five days to adjust our mentality before we choose the next target."

Hudson gave the order with a serious look.

You definitely can't do things that attract hatred. If there is an impact, then so be it. After all, there aren't many enemies for the Shaman, so it's impossible to curse everyone.

Judging from their words and actions, most people behaved normally, except for those unlucky ones who had bad tempers and showed signs of losing control of their emotions.

Hudson couldn't care less about the follow-up issues. Five days of rest was his bottom line. If he delayed any further, the opportunity would be lost.

The orc tribe is not stupid. They know that a group of killers have entered the grassland, but they still stay where they are.

As long as the position is changed, the map in Hudson's hand will be scrapped. If you want to kill the orcs, you have to find their location first.

If there were only the Alpha Kingdom and the Orc Empire in this world, then it wouldn't matter if it dragged on. Unfortunately, the situation on the Aslant Continent was too complicated, and Hudson had to consider the interference of the alien alliance.

...

The silence of the expeditionary team did not affect the spread of their reputation on the prairie. The arrogant Eagle Man Royal Court was slaughtered in blood, and more than a dozen Eagle Man tribes were ruthlessly slaughtered.

Any orc with a little knowledge knows that the Eagle Clan is finished! Maybe because of the importance of the air force, other clans will help them, but the decline of their status is inevitable.

As soon as he made a move, a royal family fell into decline, and the name of the great devil Ha once again spread across the prairie.

Unlike the last time when they bullied the weak, this time they directly targeted a royal family, and the political influence it brought was completely on a different level.

After the shock, there was endless fear. To the point that the belief in the Beast God was so high that almost all the beastmen were praying for their tribes to not run into "the group of the Great Demon King Ha".

Especially the orc tribe near the Eagleman Royal Court, they were in a state of panic, fearing that the big devil would bring people to kill them one day.

This panic soon spread from the lower class to the upper class. Although the rulers of various ethnic groups were not so afraid of Hudson, their fear of him was growing.

In the Bearman Imperial Court, all the high-ranking officials of the Orc Empire gathered together to discuss how to deal with the sneak attack by the Great Demon King Ha.

...

"Okay, everyone, stop arguing. The enemy has suddenly disappeared. They must have either returned to the human world or are hiding in a corner looking for our weakness.

Whether you are willing to accept it or not, our plan to lure the enemy has now failed.

The tragic experience of the Eagle People was just the beginning. With Hudson's style, he would either not take action or take action to the extreme.

Although the letter for help has been sent out, it will still take some time for the alliance to make a decision.

Hudson will definitely not give up for a while before the reinforcements arrive. The enemy's next target may be any one of us sitting here, and only one of us!

There are so many tribes of various ethnic groups, and they are scattered all over the place. It will take a long time to gather enough strength to fight the enemy.

During this period, we will be in a passive state for a long time. Let's come up with a rule. We can't all follow the Eagle Tribe and disperse our tribesmen to avoid it, right?"

The Silver Moon Wolf King said with a gloomy expression.

In the previous battle, apart from the Eagle People who suffered the heaviest losses, the Silver Moon Wolf Clan was the second unlucky one.

A cavalry corps of 10,000 people unfortunately ran into Hudson and his entourage. After a brief confrontation, they lay directly on the prairie, and only a few survived.

You must know that this cavalry corps was temporarily mobilized, and the place where the accident happened was a thousand miles away from the Eagleman Royal Court.

They were able to run into them directly because Hudson and his crew were setting up camp and resting, and they foolishly walked right into their own door.

Such a low probability event could be encountered directly. Even the Silver Moon Wolf King was unable to complain about such tragic luck.

Losing a cavalry corps was a minor matter, but the biggest worry was being targeted by the great devil Ha. That was not just a matter of one or two cavalry corps, but a crisis involving the survival of the race.

Looking at the tragedy of the Eagle People, we know that the enemy's assault team that infiltrated this time really has the power to destroy a large tribe.

"Constitution, what constitution do you want?

The enemy can change their target at any time. What can we do even if we are fully prepared?

If we want to keep the enemy on the prairie, we must first catch up with them. In the entire Aslant continent, who in the empire can catch up with that dragon?"

The Eagle King posed three soul-searching questions in a sarcastic tone.

Comparing speed with a giant dragon is a joke. Don't say that the Orc Empire doesn't have strong men in the Holy Domain. Even if there are strong men in the Holy Domain, they can't catch up with the giant dragon!

Of course, there are indeed some secret techniques that can increase speed in the continent of Aslant, but they all come at a price.

It's okay to use it once in a while when you're escaping, but if you use that thing to chase a dragon, you're definitely tired of living.

But everyone has no choice. The Eagleman tribe is already finished, so the Eagleman King can naturally give up. The strength of other races has not been damaged, so no matter how big the problem is, we must find a way to solve it.

Otherwise, your family will be in trouble today, my family will be attacked tomorrow, and his family will be in trouble the day after tomorrow, and we will eventually be defeated one by one by the enemy.

"Organize people to fight back!

At the beginning, we achieved considerable results, but the final outcome was somewhat tragic.

The teams that were sent out generally suffered heavy losses. The deeper they went behind enemy lines, the lower the chances of returning alive.

Including the sneak attack led by Hudson, if it weren't for the high mobility of the dragon, the team of several hundred people would have no way of evacuating safely.

Once surrounded by the army, the Saint Domain warriors would run away quickly. For ordinary rank 7 or 8 warriors, whether they could break out depended on luck.

Experts are not cabbages, how can they be sent out to take risks casually? If they really give orders recklessly, then we can only change the boss.

"This won't work, and that won't work either. We can't just sit there and let the enemy plunder the grassland, right?

Judging from the intelligence we have gathered..."

Before the Bear King could finish his words, the temperature in the tent suddenly began to rise, and the priest guarding the door hurriedly shouted: "Forbidden spell, run!"

Since he had nothing to do anyway, Hudson just pulled a group of magicians together to do some trouble.

This action is very fair. A forbidden spell is thrown on the head of a royal court. What kind of results can be achieved depends entirely on luck.

The first stop was the Bearman Royal Court.

Hudson, who had no idea how many big fish were below, was still admiring the rain of fire falling from the sky and paid no attention to the orcs fleeing in panic.

The main feature of mass destruction magic is its large range, and its single-target killing power is actually very average. For strong people above level 6, it is not a big problem to stay where they are and resist it.

However, the orcs below were obviously frightened by the name of the forbidden spell, and they were all fleeing in panic. Only a few strong ones wanted to take action to disrupt the spell.

Unfortunately, although it was a joint spellcasting this time, it was led by a powerful Sanctuary master, and the magician and grand magician played supporting roles here.

A slight elemental fluctuation could not interrupt the continuation of the forbidden spell. Instead, their actions brought disaster upon themselves.

The Holy Knights who were guarding the side rushed out immediately. The orc priest who chose to go against the flow only felt his body getting cold, and then his head was separated from his body.

Seeing many orcs running out of the forbidden spell range, Hudson shook his head secretly. This kind of large-scale attack forbidden spell is really powerful when used on the battlefield, but it's a pity that the casting speed is too slow.

There is no way. The essence of magic is to use one's own magic power as a guide, mobilize the magical elements between heaven and earth, and gather together energy to strike.

The greater the output power, the more magic elements need to be gathered, and the longer the preparation time will be.

If it weren't for these shortcomings, the Sanctuary Magician would be invincible. The power of a single forbidden spell is simply not something a mortal can withstand.

Even a giant dragon like Maxim, who had thick skin and flesh, had to dodge when seeing a single forbidden spell. If he was hit head-on, serious injuries were inevitable.

Looking down at the sea of fire rising from the ground, Hudson smiled slightly. It doesn't matter how many achievements you have made, the key is to shock people.

Just now, most of the bear people's imperial court turned into a sea of fire. I think this fire will be enough for the bear people to remember for many years.

"Let's go, the next stop is the Lion Royal Court!"

...

On the prairie, a group of orc leaders who had luckily escaped the disaster were now looking at the rising sea of fire with tears in their eyes.

When the news of the forbidden spell spread, the camp fell into complete chaos. Except for the soldiers at the edge of the forbidden spell area who had time to escape, the rest became fuel in the sea of fire.

"Hudson!"

The Bear King roared with gnashed teeth.

This is his old nest. After this wave of attacks, the ones who suffered the heaviest losses are naturally the bear people.

The expressions of the other orc leaders were not looking good either. Most of the guards they brought with them were killed in the forbidden spell just now.

Although there are only a few hundred people in each company, they are the elite among the elite, and their loyalty is at full capacity.

While feeling sad, they couldn't help but feel a little relieved that they had survived the disaster. Fortunately, the enemy didn't discover their existence, otherwise the Orc Empire would have become history today.

Then everyone's desire to become a sanctuary suddenly rose. If there were a few strong men of the same level to restrain them, the enemy would never dare to mess around so recklessly.

Elf forest.

Although the orcs are annoying, we still need them to contain the humans.

Notify our allies and have them each send out a Saint Domain, and we will send out five more to mediate this dispute and give the Alpha Kingdom a warning!"

The forest elf queen sneered.

If she hadn't considered that the catastrophe was about to come and it was not appropriate to create unnecessary trouble now, she would not mind taking the opportunity to wipe out these human sanctuaries that had emerged.

Rules are just decorations for the strong, but the prerequisite is to become the strongest. If not, then it is better to be content.

If you lose your life because of breaking the rules, then your death would be in vain.

Even within the same holy domain, there are different levels. In the eyes of the Elf Queen, the newly broken holy domains are just minor troubles.

In this regard, the immortal race has a huge advantage.

For ordinary human beings in the holy realm, it is difficult for their lifespan to exceed three hundred years unless their cultivation continues to break through.

It's impossible that people have been living in vain for such a long time, right?

Now that the elemental tides were recovering, these restrictions were also beginning to weaken. Ordinary Saint Domain masters were no longer restricted when they took action.

The reason why Hudson and his group dared to act recklessly was actually because they were ignorant and fearless.

After all, the Alpha Kingdom only has a history of more than 300 years, and the history of several other allies is similar.

Even though the history of the great nobles is quite long, the life span of humans is too short, and countless accidents have occurred in between, so the understanding of things thousands of years ago is very limited.

Even if relevant records are seen, they will be regarded as myths because they are too different from reality.

Except for some ancient forces with a long history, no one knows these secrets. The human race can become the overlord of the continent, so naturally there will be no shortage of top powerhouses.

Although their life span cannot catch up with that of the elves, they have a large population base. The elemental tides are turbulent every three hundred years, and ordinary sanctuaries will naturally die, but if they can enter the second level of the sanctuary, their life span can be doubled.

No matter how small the probability is, there will always be a few lucky ones. It's just that the elemental tide is at a low point, and the magic elements between heaven and earth are too thin to support them.

Forcibly attacking would affect their lifespan, so they had no choice but to retire. Some strong men even left the mainland and fled overseas to practice in seclusion.

...

"Meteor shower!"

"Meteorites are falling from the sky!"

"Ice World!"

...

For a time, the Orc Empire became a magic testing ground, and all the forbidden spells that the expedition team could cast were performed on the prairie.

In this regard, Hudson was very fair. The royal family enjoyed the most powerful forbidden spell, and the royal family enjoyed the second-level one.

Forget about the ordinary orcs, there are too many of them and it is really difficult to deal with them.

In fact, the Mage Corps couldn't stand it anymore before the seven royal families had time to visit them all!

Although there is Ha's magic potion that can restore health, everyone has always believed that this thing is too precious and cannot be used as a consumable item.

The cost is tens of thousands or even hundreds of thousands, and it is obviously a high-end product. Coupled with its good efficacy, it is the best magic potion in the continent.

If people knew that the cost was only a few gold coins, then no matter how good the effect was, it would just feel like cheap stuff.

Pessimism was spreading across the prairie. Except for the small tribes that were cut off from information, almost all the orcs were in a state of panic, fearing that the great devil would come knocking on their door someday.

"Marshal, our operation went too smoothly. The orcs did not take any counterattack measures except to evade. This is really abnormal.

Robert said worriedly.

The orc's reaction was too simple, nothing but panic, which was totally different from the orc he had in mind.

"Don't worry, Mr. Robert. I select the targets for each operation randomly. There is no pattern at all.

Even if the orcs were prepared, they would not be able to take care of all the tribes on the prairie.

Gather the strong to fight back, maybe they have already started to act. But it is meaningless, we can't stay here and fight them.

But it shouldn't be a big problem. Even when pushed to this point, no strong men from the Holy Land showed up in the Orc Empire, which is enough to prove that the orcs have been disconnected.

Unless something drastic happens, if the Alpha Kingdom wants to destroy the orcs, it will inevitably have to confront the elves.

If they are destined to be enemies, then there is no need to give them face. Unless the racial conflict ends one day, Hudson will not be friends with the elves.

"Marshal Hudson, your mouth is still as foul as ever. It's only been a few months since we last met, but your courage continues to grow.

Deli hit back without any hesitation.

"impossible!"
