Viscount Catalino added.

"good!"

After the first "yes", the nobles participating in the meeting soon expressed their agreement in twos and threes.

All of Viscount Catalino's proposals were passed, and a group of emerging nobles displayed their best skills and carried out large-scale looting and destruction in the city.

The hundreds of years of accumulation of the capital city became their spoils of war. Countless wealth was loaded onto the ship and packed up and left.

Not only were the wealth looted, but all the facilities in the royal capital, including the shipyards, military factories, and magic academy, began to be relocated.

Anything that cannot be taken away will be destroyed directly; anyone who refuses to leave will be sent directly to see the Lord of Dawn.

At this moment, no one cared about whether to return or not. What everyone wanted now was not to leave any supplies to aid the enemy.

No one cared about the damage caused by this. It was obvious that most people had the awareness that there was no return.

As long as you look carefully, you will always be able to find a place to settle down in the vast ocean. Many nobles even have ready-made islands in their hands.

The population and wealth taken away now will be the resources for developing new territories in the future.

...

Fort Cameron, the Governor's residence.

"What, the rebels are evacuating the capital?"

Marquis McCarton asked in disbelief.

The capital city that was finally in their hands was now given up just like that. The contempt that they had for the rebels turned into solemnity.

Being able to remain rational in the face of wealth and glory is definitely not a fool without a brain. A person with brains would not do such a stupid thing as hacking the king to death. Even if there is a blood feud, he would find another way to disguise it as a normal death.

His intuition told him that there might be another hidden story behind the regicide. However, at this point, no matter what the truth was, the new noble group was bound to bear the crime of "regicide".

"Yes, Marquis!

Even though he knew that the rebels were withdrawing, Marquis McCarton had to be cautious in order to maintain his strength and gain an advantage in the upcoming battle for the throne.

There were many other nobles who made similar choices, and their reasons were similar. Without the royal banner, the Falcon Kingdom was actually on the verge of disintegration.

Referring to the cases of countries splitting apart in history, the Falcon Kingdom already has most of the conditions and will become history if it is not careful.

At times like this, the old nobles became more cautious, creating favorable conditions for the rebels to evacuate.

The changes in the Falcon Kingdom have attracted the attention of high-level officials from various countries, and the cult organization that launched the rebellion is also unwilling to be left out.

It was as if overnight, the evil god suddenly became healthy. As long as the believers performed sacrifices, they would be able to obtain the power feedback from the gods.

Although the side effects of external force enhancement are significant, it is indeed the best way to quickly enhance strength in the short term.

With the help of the evil god, the power of the cult organization continued to grow, causing great losses to the governments of various countries that were slow to realize the situation.

The three kingdoms in the Central Continent were the third of the victims. Without knowing the specific strength of the enemy, they foolishly sent troops to suppress the rebellion based on past experience.

The result is naturally self-evident. The Hesse Kingdom, at the center of the storm, is a tragedy within a tragedy.

In just over a month, more than twenty counties fell one after another, and many rebels joined together and became a powerful force.

House seemingly endless rain!

The cult crisis has not yet subsided, and the continent of Aslant has encountered extremely bad weather again this year, either drought or floods. In any case, most people's grain harvests have been poor this year.

The chaos of war and the disaster only fueled the rebellion. Countless bankrupt freemen joined the rebels in order to survive.

For a time, the smoke of gunpowder filled most of the Aslant continent. The only countries that were able to maintain peace and tranquility were the few countries that reaped the benefits of the war in the continental war.

Hudson had to take charge of drought relief and flood rescue work just after returning to the territory from the capital. In the face of the might of nature, human power is insignificant.

A severe drought broke out in Snow Moon Territory, and no rain had fallen since the beginning of summer. The territory was supported entirely by the water conservancy projects built in the past, and even magicians were dispatched to create artificial rainfall at critical moments.

Even so, the grain output was only maintained at 70%. The expansion of the planting area should have been a year of increased production, but the total grain output fell by 5%.

Life seemed peaceful in the mountainous territory, but at the critical moment of autumn harvest, a flood broke out that was rare in a century.

The rain poured down like a bucket, and the mountainous area seemed to have been turned into a swamp overnight.

The original mining area became the source of the disaster. The loose soil, washed away by heavy rain, turned into a mudslide that swallowed everything.

The drainage project in the territory encountered the greatest test since its construction. Countless farmlands were destroyed by the heavy rain.

The water level in the canal was also rising, and the soil washed down was constantly filling the riverbed.

If Hudson had not asked Bear Stearns to help dredge the river, a disaster would have occurred.

All the troops and reserve forces in the territory were organized and mobilized, and rushed to various places to carry out rescue and disaster relief.

However, the losses continue to mount.

The rain was still pouring down, and Hudson rubbed his forehead helplessly as he looked at the devastating scene.

The drought in the Snow Moon Territory could be dealt with properly, but the floods in the Mountain Territory could only be dealt with passively.

The rainfall area is so wide that several provinces in the kingdom are experiencing the baptism of the storm.

In order to reduce the losses, Hudson even forced Maxim to do hard labor to drive the dark clouds towards the sea.

Unfortunately, there were too many dark clouds floating in the air currents. When one cloud was driven away, a new one would immediately appear.

One dragon is obviously not enough, and adding a bear is still far from enough.

Hudson had calculated that with the amount of clouds and rainfall gathering in the mountainous territory, it would be impossible to handle it without a hundred or eighty adult dragons.

There is no doubt that this is impossible. Even if the dragon uncles came to their door, they could not afford the price of hiring so many dragons.

"Disasters continue one after another, and a poor harvest is inevitable. I'm afraid the days ahead will be difficult!"

Hudson was inspired.

Chapter 235: Bank Run

The boy never smiled as he inspected the disaster. Hudson suffered heavy losses from this natural disaster, and Bear Stearns' losses were not much smaller.

Investing is risky, so be cautious when entering the market.

Agriculture has never been an industry that makes quick money. Natural disasters not only reduce grain production, but many water conservancy projects are also forced to be rebuilt.

Just this year's losses alone will require Hudson and Bear Stearns to work for several years in vain to make up for the losses.

In comparison, Maxim's business is more profitable and risk-free.

During the estrus period, if you live a muddle-headed life for a while, you can earn millions of gold coins.

Calculated purely on the income from farming, even if the weather is good, the mountain territories will be busy for several years.

Only Maxim has the ability to make money by selling his kidneys, and others can't even envy him.

Hudson's heart was bleeding as he watched the losses being counted. According to the agricultural department's estimate, at most 40% of the autumn crops in the mountainous region could be saved.

Hudson could accept a simple reduction in grain production in one season.

After all, their territory was opened up from the swamp, and it has always been a place with abundant rain. It is normal for the losses to be greater under flood disasters.

The trouble lies in the post-disaster reconstruction work. There are tens of thousands of houses in the entire mountain area that need to be rebuilt, and several water conservancy projects need major repairs, among which more than a dozen water conservancy projects have suffered devastating blows.

There was also considerable damage to roads and bridges.

In addition, the problem of soil erosion in the mining area was also exposed.

Everything costs money. The exact extent of the losses will only be known after the rainstorm ends.

The only consolation is that Hudson is not the only unlucky one. Most areas of Aslant have suffered natural disasters, but the way they are presented are different.

...

In the Emerald Palace, Caesar IV was busy making personnel adjustments. Having learned from the tragedy of the Falcon family, he decided to replace all the palace guards and city guards with "his own people".

The strongest fortress is always breached from within.

The Falcon Kingdom is a typical example. The rebels were able to quickly capture the capital because some of the city guards also participated in the rebellion.

The palace fell quickly, and the emerging nobles in the palace guards cooperated from both inside and outside to open the palace gates and let the enemy in.

Only a few diehard fans of the royal family truly fought to the last moment.

"This is the disaster report from various places. So far, thirteen provinces have requested tax reductions and exemptions and the allocation of disaster relief funds!"

The words of the Chancellor, the Grand Duke of Newfoundland, pulled Caesar IV out of the power struggle.

Replacing people can be done at any time, and no nobles will rebel in the short term, but the disaster is imminent.

After taking over the public relations, the few thin pages of paper seemed to weigh a thousand pounds.

Although there were only thirteen provinces that requested tax reduction and exemption and disaster relief funds, there were only about twenty provinces in the kingdom that were currently required to pay taxes in full.

The rest are either completely tax-free or require a symbolic fee.

If their taxes were really reduced, the kingdom would have a hard time in the future.

In the agricultural era, governments' reliance on taxation was surprisingly high.

How to fill the fiscal gap of tens of millions of gold coins?

After carefully reading the report, Caesar IV was surprised to find that many royal lords were also in the disaster area.

He vaguely remembered the official document sent by the Prime Minister a few days ago. However, he was busy with personnel adjustments and did not deal with it in time.

A direct refusal would seem too inhumane.

It would be unacceptable for the royal government not to make any statement in the year of the disaster.

It's even more impossible to agree!

Just reducing or exempting taxes would deal a heavy blow to the kingdom's finances, not to mention allocating funds for disaster relief.

Moreover, the disaster-stricken area is so wide that if the demands of these thirteen provinces are agreed to, the other provinces will most likely follow suit.

Such a funding hole could even bankrupt the kingdom's finances.

"Marquis Delgado, what do you think about this matter?"

Caesar IV asked the Chancellor of Finance.

Since it is not convenient for me to be the bad guy, I can only push the finance minister to take the blame. In any case, most of the projects related to money that were rejected in the past were done by the Ministry of Finance.

The more times you offend people, the less they care.

After all, it was common knowledge how bad the kingdom's finances were.

"Your Majesty, this matter is still a little complicated.

The scope of this disaster is so wide that it is rare to see such a disaster in hundreds of years.

Logically speaking, the royal government should reduce taxes and provide assistance to local nobles.

But now we have no money in the treasury, we have the will but not the ability!"

Marquis Delgado politely declined.

The art of language cannot change the final result. Lack of money is always the biggest killer.

Among all the ministers in the kingdom, the one who was least afraid of packing up and going home was Marquis Delgado.

Everyone knows that this is a mess. No matter who is in power and does the job, it is just a matter of robbing Peter to pay Paul.

The worst thing is to compare yourself with your ex, and if you are not careful you will end up being criticized.

If the kingdom's finances really go bankrupt during his term of office, the Chancellor of the Exchequer will be the biggest scapegoat.

If things go wrong, we may even have to borrow someone's head to appease public anger.

Among the great nobles, no one was interested in this hot position. There were some people among the small and medium nobles who were eager to try, but no one dared to let them take the position.

After all, in the eyes of a group of vested interests, putting a fool in the position of Chancellor of the Exchequer is the greatest irresponsibility to the kingdom.

"Prime Minister, what do you think?"

Caesar IV continued to ask.

The Grand Duke of Newfoundland felt mixed emotions as he watched the king he had personally helped to ascend the throne become more and more proficient in the art of ruling.

For the royal family, the better the king is, the better; but for the prime minister, it is just the opposite.

But the Grand Duke of Newfoundland had made outstanding contributions and had a great influence in the court. Caesar IV could not suppress him even if he wanted to.

The king's mature use of imperial skills actually indicated that his resignation was not far away.

"Your Majesty, you should do everything within your capabilities!

I think taxes should be reduced or exempted as appropriate within the fiscal capacity.

Disaster relief funds can also be distributed based on actual conditions."

The answer from the Prime Minister, the Grand Duke of Newfoundland, seemed a bit wishy-washy, but for the Alpha Kingdom at the moment, it was already the best option.

The biggest advantage of the tax-package system is that no matter what happens, there is someone to cover the taxes.

The Royal Government can choose to reduce or exempt taxes, but it is not obliged to do so.

Giving a symbolic amount is actually taking care of the face of all parties.

Caesar IV frowned slightly, obviously this was not the answer he wanted.

If possible, he would prefer to use this as an opportunity to promote reforms to the kingdom's tax system.

Unfortunately, the prime minister did not understand his meaning. Or rather, he thought about it but did not want to cooperate with his actions.

There is no strong support within the government. The probability of success is too low with only the wishful thinking of the Ministry of Finance and the support of the king.

Referring to the kingdom's previous reforms, they were all successful due to strong government promotion and the support of some local powerful groups.

The current situation is obviously different. Tax system reform is actually cutting the flesh of the nobles.

The royal government took more, and the nobles naturally got less. Without money, how could they support their troops?

It's not that everyone's core has changed, it's just that the competition within the aristocratic group is too fierce.

The useless people who had no ability were basically all dead. Most of the lords in this group had been on the battlefield.

After witnessing the bloodshed on the battlefield with your own eyes, if you still don't know how to expand your military and prepare for war, then you must be mentally ill.

Compared with the strengthening of the kingdom's military power, everyone would rather see their own armed forces grow stronger.

In terms of capital utilization, the royal government may not be able to compare with the noble lords in terms of money utilization.

"Then let's do this first!"

Caesar IV said with disappointment.

Deep down in his heart, he reaffirmed his determination to strengthen the royal power.

...

The little episode in the capital soon faded away. The confrontation between the king and the prime minister was a secret that belonged only to the highest level.

The noble lords who were affected by the disaster are now busy organizing production to save themselves.

The untrained serfs were relatively slow, but they knew how to learn from their companions and could barely keep up.

Even though everyone knows that production cuts are inevitable, everyone is still busy trying to save themselves in order to minimize losses.

But at this moment, all the noble lords were surprisingly unanimous in their stance, trying their best to recover food from the natural disaster.

Due to the huge amount of work, during the actual operation, a lot of rye was directly roasted by Maxim, and some of it became charcoal.

In line with the principle of not wasting anything, the spoiled rye became food for the orc slaves.

The people in the territory lived on fried wheat and boiled wheat flour.

In a year of disaster, it's good enough to have something to eat, so naturally no one would be picky about the taste.

After the storm, there is finally a rainbow!

The flood came quickly and receded quickly. On the third day after the rain stopped, everything gradually returned to normal.

However, the disaster brought by the flood remained. Post-disaster reconstruction slowly began, and Hudson no longer needed to take care of these tasks himself.

Relevant agencies such as government departments, agricultural departments, and transportation departments have all come up with corresponding plans and put them into action.

...

"Your Excellency, due to the disaster, many depositors have come to withdraw their deposits in advance, and there are queues in front of many branches.

In just one week, deposits at the Near East Development Bank fell by eight million gold coins, accounting for five percent of our cash reserves.

There is a saying circulating in the outside world that the Near East Development Bank is better than all the banks in the northern continent.

It is no exaggeration to say that the Near East Development Bank, which has taken advantage of its first-mover advantage and captured the best customer base, alone accounts for 90% of the profits of all commercial banks in the northern continent.

Apart from this giant, all commercial banks are regional banks and simply do not have the ability to expand their business outlets throughout the northern continent.

No matter how small a bank is, it has some influence in its own territory.

In order to compete with the Near East Development Bank, they not only lowered the loan interest rate, but also increased the deposit interest rate.

Relying on these means, they have gained a place in the market competition. However, risks are also buried. Once a run occurs, it is only a matter of time before these small banks with insufficient reserves go bankrupt.

Eliminating competitors would be a good thing for the Near East Development Bank, but panic can spread.

Once a large number of small commercial banks go bankrupt and are unable to repay depositors' funds, the Near East Development Bank will inevitably be affected.

"Pass the order on. In the coming period, all commercial loans handled must undergo the most stringent review.

With a large number of competitors reduced, the future "money" power will be even more limitless.

Chapter 236: A Difficult Sutra

The world is fair. The Aslant continent has suffered a natural disaster that occurs only once in a century, and naturally the Alpha Kingdom is not the only one that is unlucky.

A series of natural disasters such as drought, floods, earthquakes, typhoons, and tsunamis continue to occur across the mainland.

From humans to aliens, all were attacked indiscriminately, and no one was immune.

Affected by natural disasters, the rebels that had been contained have once again started a new round of explosive growth.

Various countries were busy with disaster relief work and suppressing rebellions, and for a while, the rebels of the Falcon Kingdom were forgotten.

However, despite their busy schedules, representatives from several major countries still met and exchanged their opinions and views.

In the end, everyone came to a unanimous conclusion that intervention was necessary, but the Human Alliance meeting could not be held.

What everyone needs is to eliminate the adverse political influence, rather than expand the influence of the rebels. Once the alliance meeting is held, it will definitely be recorded in history books.

It would be difficult to erase this disgraceful existence at that time. After all, there are rebels in every group, and there are also nobles who are keen on recording dark history.

To study the history of the Aslant continent, one must combine official history with unofficial history. Often, the secrets recorded by the old nobles are far more reliable than those circulated in the outside world.

After a series of procedures were completed and the countries were discussing how to send troops, the rebels of the Falcon Kingdom had already evacuated the capital.

Some of the rebel nobles whose identities were exposed returned to their fiefdoms to defend themselves, while others simply evacuated to the sea with their families.

It looked like the rebels knew they had gotten into big trouble and simply fled in all directions.

Similar cases have occurred in the past. The rebels no longer exist and the joint intervention has become a pipe dream.

Except for the Holy See, the Frankish Kingdom and the Libyan Kingdom, which still wanted to intervene, the Five-Nation Alliance had completely lost interest.

The ownership of the throne of the Falcon Kingdom has no meaning to the Five-Nation Alliance.

They would only be happy to see the rebels disperse on their own. The subsequent armed suppression was the new king's business and no outsiders needed to worry about it.

No matter who comes to power, the first priority is to avenge Henry V, and then they can legally inherit the royal throne.

Without the intervention of the Five Nations Alliance, the Falcon Kingdom was still lively. The intervention of the Holy See, Frank, and Yin Libya directly divided the nobles of the Falcon Kingdom into three.

The three major camps fought fiercely for the vacant throne, and even the intention to suppress the rebellion was weakened for a while.

Hudson was not very clear about the specific situation. Anyway, he knew that the Falcon Kingdom was very lively at the moment.

How long this farce will last does not depend on the infighting among the local nobles of the Falcon Kingdom, but on the game between the three major forces behind the scenes.

There was no time to worry about the future of the Falcon Kingdom. As soon as the flood ended, Hudson's attention was drawn to the Orc Prairie.

The Xueyue Territory, which owns the Xueyue Lake, has suffered a severe drought, and the situation of the Orc Empire will only get worse.

The occurrence of natural disasters has intensified the conflicts between the tribes. In order to compete for water sources, the orc tribes on the prairie often fight each other.

Even if the royal court issued a truce order, it would become worthless in the face of the survival pressure of the tribe.

The constantly accumulating social contradictions will inevitably affect the strategic decision-making of the Orc Empire. Referring to the practice of natural disasters in the past, they always ended with the orcs invading the kingdom.

If you win on the battlefield, you can rely on the spoils to survive the crisis; if you are unfortunately defeated, the person who caused the problem will be gone.

Putting yourself in Hudson's shoes, if he were a high-ranking official in the Orc Empire, he would also choose to use war to divert domestic conflicts.

As for the fact that the various races were severely injured and unsuitable for waging war, in the face of the pressure of racial survival, it was really not an insurmountable difficulty.

Looking at the intelligence collected, within just one month, hundreds of tribal conflicts broke out within the Orc Empire in order to compete for water sources and pastures.

This is just statistical data. The Kingdom's intelligence department's infiltration of the Orc Empire is not unlimited, and there are still large areas that are blank.

Hudson did not forget that in addition to the prairie, the Orc Empire also has large areas of hills and mountains, as well as vast plateaus.

Although the land in these areas is barren, as long as the area is large enough, it can still feed a large population.

After suffering severe losses at the hands of the human coalition forces, these areas were once regarded as the rear base of the Orc Empire and were focused on management.

What the current situation is like, the intelligence department has not yet infiltrated, and Hudson doesn't know.

However, land development is a long process. The civilization process of the Orc Empire is still in the transition stage from nomadic civilization to agricultural civilization, and the racial productivity is still very low.

It would take more than 358 years to develop the rear area. Considering the fact that the various ethnic groups were hindering each other, this period of time might even be longer.

"Tom, send a war warning to the noble lords in the Near East!"

Hudson suddenly ordered.

Only he could issue a war warning in advance when there were no signs that a war was about to break out.

Other generals, even if they had doubts in their hearts, did not dare to jump to conclusions. If they were wrong, they would need to take responsibility.

The reason why Hudson didn't mind taking risks was mainly due to the coup in the Falcon Kingdom.

Caesar IV seemed to still have full trust in the powerful people in the kingdom, but a series of personnel adjustments still exposed his true thoughts.

When the boss becomes suspicious, if the younger brother wants to stay safe, he must know when to advance and when to retreat.

It is too late to hide your shortcomings. With the glorious achievements before, the more you try to hide your shortcomings, the more likely you are to end up making things worse.

However, Hudson became more and more bold when making strategic judgments. Misjudgment would indeed affect one's personal reputation, but this was what the king wanted to see.

It is too difficult to control a "god". The subordinates the king needs are "people" rather than a "god" who can plan everything.

If nothing unexpected happens, after defeating the Orc Empire again, Hudson will live a life of luxury.

If a man does not indulge in romance when young, he will live his youth in vain!

He is already so successful that he threatens the boss. If he doesn't have a bunch of lovers and dilute the sacred aura around him, how can the boss feel at ease?

If you refer to historical materials, you will know that no hero without any stain will have a good ending in the end.

On the contrary, people like "Wang Jian" and "Guo Ziyi" who knew how to defile themselves were doing better.

Although Hudson did not think that Caesar IV had the courage to massacre his meritorious officials, he still tried to avoid troubles that could be avoided.

As a subject, if you foolishly confront the monarch head-on, you will definitely suffer a great loss.

Even if it was not stated explicitly, Hudson was very clear that there were many royal family members in his camp.

Not only did the royal family plant thorns in his team, but all the major forces in the kingdom also planted thorns in his team.

In addition to Hudson's efforts, these "nails" also made great contributions to the rapid rise of the Koslow family.

At present, everyone's interests are the same, so everything is tacitly understood. If there is a conflict one day, the internal problems will be enough to give Hudson a headache.

There is no way, this is the way to play in the continent of Aslant: you are in me and I am in you.

The Koslo family rose to prominence in too short a time. If it had developed for a hundred or eighty years, it would have been able to sow discord among the major forces in the kingdom.

It is impossible to stop it, because the strength of a family depends not only on its own strength, but also on the strength of its vassals.

At present, Hudson's strength comes from his family, at most one-third, and the other two-thirds come from the nobles who are dependent on him.

The degree of loyalty is very magical. It manifests itself differently in different situations and cannot be simply judged as high or low.

For example: When facing the Orc Empire, these vassals are Hudson's most staunch supporters.

If Hudson wanted to set up his own company, the situation would be awkward. Not to mention that the vassal power was unreliable, even the power of the family lineage might not be reliable.

Thousands of years of traditional education cannot be reversed in just a few years.

Those who talk about loyalty without considering the context of the times are simply being hooligans.

Leading by example, following suit is applicable in any era.

Hudson didn't like double standards. He wasn't even 100% loyal to the king, so why should he expect his men to be loyal to him?

The favor of promotion is based on the other person's achievements, and is not a gift given for no reason.

...

Orc Empire.

The continued drought and lack of rain have made life difficult not only for ordinary orcs, but even the royal family and the royal families have felt the pressure.

In this context, as soon as a new round of royal court meetings was held, the clan leaders of various tribes began to complain one after another.

"enough!

We all know the situation on the prairie, so there is no need to reiterate it.

The hot summer continues to this day, a large amount of grassland has withered, and the tribes are constantly fighting over water issues.

The reason we gathered everyone here today is to discuss how to reasonably allocate water resources and avoid conflicts!"

The Lion King scolded harshly.

The tent suddenly became quiet, but the atmosphere was still as depressing.

"Reasonable distribution of water resources" is just a joke for children. The Orc Empire advocates the survival of the fittest. How can a weak race compete with a strong race?

No matter how reasonable the distribution is, when it comes to implementation, it is inevitable that some people will take more than they deserve.

"Lion King, the key issue now is not how to distribute water, but that the drought is still continuing.

If the drought problem is not resolved, it will be difficult for us to store enough fodder before winter!"

The words of the Bear King broke the last layer of window paper.

After the population decreased, there was enough living space for all ethnic groups, and they could maintain "good neighborly relations".

A severe drought changed all that.

Affected by the drought, not only is there a shortage of fodder and water to meet demand, but a large number of diseases and insect pests are also spreading across the prairie.

A few days ago, there was a locust plague. If everyone hadn't reacted quickly enough, it would have almost caused a disaster.

"Bear King, I am naturally aware of these issues. I even know that in order to survive, many tribes are secretly trading with humans.

The objects of trade were not only furs, but also livestock such as cattle, horses, sheep, and even slaves.

As long as they can exchange it for food, there is nothing they dare not sell.

But knowing is one thing, and solving the problem is another.

Such a large-scale drought, even if all the shamans were exhausted to death, it would not solve the problem!"

The Lion King said helplessly.

Supernatural powers can change the world, but they have their limits. It's OK to create artificial rainfall once in a while, but it's simply unrealistic to do it every now and then and cover the entire prairie.

The number of sacrifices in the Orc Empire was small, and the number of sacrifices in the water system was even smaller. Playing artificial rainfall would consume a lot of sacrifices.

Especially in the current situation, the sky is clear every day and it is difficult to see even a dark cloud, making it even more difficult to rain.

Under the double blow of "high temperature" and "severe drought", the fragile grassland ecology is being broken.

First the herbivores are facing a food crisis, then it will be the turn of the carnivores. If there is a severe drought, many plants and animals will become extinct.

A similar scene also took place within the Orc Empire. If there was not enough water to share, then the law of the jungle would prevail.

It is normal for weak and endangered races to be eliminated in such an environment.

Anyway, the holy land of heritage has just been opened not long ago, and it is impossible to come back for a second time in a short period of time, so it will not hurt to reduce some orc races.

As for future issues, new races will naturally emerge after several more crossbreedings.

The last Behemoth King was one of the best. Although the situation at that time was special, he still contributed to the prosperity of the Orc Empire.

"In fact, there is an old way. People will be sacrificed anyway, so instead of letting them die in internal strife, it is better to let them die on the battlefield.

Although we don't have much chance of winning if we start a war at this moment, all human countries, including the Alpha Kingdom, have also suffered heavy losses in this natural disaster.

All countries have reduced their production, and the whole continent is in a food shortage. Now even if you have money, it is difficult to buy large amounts of food on the market.

This means that even if we lose on the battlefield, the enemy will not be able to organize a large-scale counterattack.

As long as we control the rhythm of the war, don't blindly engage in a decisive battle with the enemy, and guard against the enemy's sneak attacks from the rear, that's enough! "

The Silver Moon Wolf King said with a sneer.

A method doesn't have to be old, as long as it works. If a war is launched at this moment, the Orc Empire will surely be a river of blood.

The problem is that if we don't provoke an external war, a civil war will break out!

Now it is just a fight between tribes. If no measures are taken, it will turn into a racial fight.

"The Wolf King's suggestion is very good, but for now it is best to wait and see, and take action after the situation on the mainland becomes clearer.

If conditions do not allow, then limit the scale of the war. It is best to control it to a local conflict, so that no matter how it develops later, it can be properly handled. "

The Eagle King's words were very cowardly, lacking the domineering attitude of a royal family. However, the orcs agreed that it was time to be more cautious.

In the past years, the Orc Empire has taken countless risks, and the final results have always ended in tragedy.

...

The Kingdom of Hesse, as an area severely affected by the cult rebellion, was hit by a wave of natural disasters that occurred once in a century. Alexander V was in a very bad state.

Combined with the development of the Kingdom of Hesse in recent years, it is a typical decline from prosperity, and there is even a hint of the country's demise.

Recalling the high-spiritedness of forcing the Kingdom of Alpha to compromise and annexing the County of Corubia in previous years, Alexander V suddenly felt old.

For a king, it is too cruel to witness his kingdom go from prosperity to decline.

Although they knew that the king was not in a good state, none of the ministers came forward to comfort him. There was no other way, as everyone was in a similar mental state.

Just now, they received another piece of bad news: Marquis Ginsburg led his troops to suppress the rebellion, but was defeated and tens of thousands of troops suffered heavy losses.

After this battle, Marquis Lelian no longer had an armed force capable of competing with the rebels in the province of Mysia, and it could be said that the province was almost on the countdown to its fall.

Time passed by minute by minute. Alexander V gradually recovered and glanced at everyone. Then he said, "Where is Marquis Lelian, and where did his army go to suppress the rebellion?"

A typical misfortune!

There were so many rebels, and the army that was suppressing the rebellion was advancing all the way, and they couldn't move any faster.

"Your Majesty, the army led by Marquis Lelian is on the way to suppress the rebellion and is expected to arrive in Mysia Province within ten days.

By then, these rebel rabble will be wiped off the map like fallen leaves in the autumn wind!"

The calm words of the Minister of Military Affairs, Count Niklas, made the ministers happy, but then they frowned again.

If things were that simple, the rebels wouldn't have grown to such a size.

...
Chapter 557:
Chapter 237: Know Yourself and Know Your Enemy

To make matters worse, while the situation in the province of Mysia was being discussed, three letters requesting help arrived from the front line.

The Minister of Military Affairs, who had been full of confidence, was suddenly dumbfounded.

Simply suppressing the rebellion was no problem for the Kingdom of Hessen, but the problem was that most of the kingdom's main forces were concentrated on the front lines.

According to the original idea, in addition to a part of the troops stationed in the royal capital, the main responsibility of the kingdom's standing army was to garrison the border, and the nobles' private army was responsible for maintaining local security.

No one expected that this perfect military structure would be broken after the cult rebellion and natural disasters.

The more chaos there was in the country, the less they dared to mobilize the army on the front line. If the troops moved just before the front foot, the foreign army took advantage of the fire to loot and kill, it would be a tragedy.

The army left behind in the royal capital has been withdrawn three times. If more troops are withdrawn from it, everyone will have trouble sleeping.

The sudden change in the situation made things suddenly complicated.

Under normal circumstances, the nobles would not ask for help from the royal government. After all, it was their own territory, and no one wanted to be told what to do.

Four provinces were forced to ask the royal government for help. It is easy to imagine how dangerous the local situation was. If the situation continued to deteriorate, it would be the end of the dynasty.

Alexander V, who prided himself on being a great ruler, would never allow such a thing to happen.

"Everyone is dumb!"

"Aren't you quite capable in normal times? Why do you become dumb at the critical moment?"

"And these four idiots who asked for help can't even protect their own territory. They are such losers!"

...

The endless curses continued to ring in everyone's ears. At this moment, Alexander V no longer had the demeanor of a monarch as before.

Perhaps because he had been holding it for too long, Alexander V felt particularly relaxed when he suddenly put it down.

The anger that had been accumulating was almost vented after a burst of anger, and his tone gradually returned to normal.

"Tell me, what should we do now?"

The topic was suddenly brought back to the track of solving the problem. The people who were scolded with their heads down felt very uncomfortable and almost suspected that there was something wrong with their ears.

After hesitating for a while, the Prime Minister, Duke of Milton, replied: "Your Majesty, in view of the deteriorating situation in the country, we must prepare for the worst.

Judging from the intelligence collected from various places, rebels of varying sizes have appeared in almost every province, and it is likely that we will not be able to mobilize troops from other provinces to quell the rebellion.

The only solution now is to ask for help from the Five Nations Alliance. The Northern Continent was not badly damaged by this wave of cult rebellion, as the Alpha Kingdom and the Moshi Principality had suppressed the rebellion.

To both countries..."

As he was speaking, Duke Milton suddenly couldn't continue. Asking for help from an ally was embarrassing enough, and asking for help from a principality was really embarrassing.

It doesn't matter if you don't say it, the meaning has been expressed, and everyone knows what to do next.

"Marquis Krasner, I'll leave this matter to you to coordinate. There is only one principle: the core interests of the kingdom cannot be touched. You can handle the rest!"

Alexander V made the decision immediately.

Speed is of the essence on the battlefield, and calling for help is even more urgent. Alexander V, who did not want to be the king of a fallen country, showed the responsibility that a king should have at this moment.

It's embarrassing, so what? The situation has deteriorated to this point, and the international reputation of the Kingdom of Hesse has long since fallen to the bottom.

If we delay any further, it won't just be a matter of face, but we will lose our substance.

Although asking for help comes at a price, this part of the loss is controllable. After all, we are allies and we have a common enemy, so we must always leave a way out when doing things.

...

The wheel of history keeps moving forward, and when the Kingdom of Hesse could no longer hold on and had to seek external help, the cult rebellion reached its climax.

Not only are the human countries having a hard time, but the alien races are also having a hard time. Even the elves, who are known for their unity, now have a new branch - the fallen elves!

This is all normal operation. Aliens can sponsor cults in the human world, and humans will naturally sponsor cults among aliens.

In order to support the evil cult organizations in the alien world, the Human Alliance has also set up special funds.

In addition, countries on the mainland will instinctively support some cult organizations among other ethnic groups.

Hudson didn't know much about the cult organizations in other places, but several major cult organizations within the Orc Empire had received funding from him.

The grassland was hit by a severe drought, which was a good opportunity for the spread of cult ideas. Without any hesitation, Hudson asked the intelligence department to sponsor these cult organizations with supplies.

They are all primitive cult organizations, which are at least two eras behind the cult groups active in the human world.

If he was not concerned about the impact, he would have wanted to help these cult organizations compile an activity program.

After much hesitation, Hudson gave up the idea. There was no other reason, but he was simply worried about the execution ability of these cult organizations.

The more perfect the program is, the more attention it pays to detail management and the higher the requirements for people will be.

The orcs' level of civilization is there, and asking them to do such a complicated task is obviously making things difficult for them.

...

"You mean, a new cult has emerged in the Orc Empire, and it didn't come to us for sponsorship?"

Hudson asked excitedly.

He had seen many cult organizations in the Orc Empire, but this was the first time Hudson had heard of a cult organization like this that gave up soliciting sponsorship for the sake of safety.

It's not that the cult must get sponsorship from outside, it's mainly because the Orc Empire is too poor, including the pockets of the four royal families are empty.

In this context, the little wealth contributed by believers is barely enough to cover the cost of activities.

"Yes, Marshal!

This organization is very hidden. If it weren't for a chance encounter, we wouldn't know it existed.

Judging from the intelligence collected, this organization likes to provoke fights between orc tribes.

Recently, there have been endless racial feuds and tribal wars within the Orc Empire. In addition to our efforts, they have also contributed a lot. "

After hearing Zero's answer, Hudson became more interested. His intuition told him that this mysterious organization was related to the previous border conflict.

Originally, he wanted to find out the culprit behind this, but after seeing that these guys were actively provoking internal strife among the orcs, Hudson suddenly realized that it was not a bad idea to keep these guys.

All the evil cults that tormented the orcs were good cults. It was better to let the orcs die in internal strife than to let them appear on the battlefield with the kingdom.

"Keep watching them, don't rush to approach them. If they are determined, they will come to you sooner or later!"

Hudson said with a smile.

Any ambitious orc cult organization will inevitably move closer to the kingdom in the end. This is determined by reality.

Lack of supplies is only one aspect. If one wants to overthrow the rule of the royal family and become bigger and stronger, one is doomed to rely on the support of the Alpha Kingdom.

This is a win-win deal. The cult organization wants to rebel and go ashore, and the Alpha Kingdom needs a divided Orc Empire. There is a basis for cooperation between the two parties.

Hudson was not afraid of these cults becoming bigger, but he was afraid that they would not grow bigger. If he could launch a rebellion similar to the Netherworld Cult in the Orc Empire, he would make a fortune.

But this is just a thought, the racial barrier is not so easy to break. The four major royal families + the seven royal families almost include all the powerful people in the Orc Empire, and the remaining races are obviously inferior in strength.

The three tribes responsible for guarding the front lines are now considered powerful within the Orc Empire.

But compared with the eleven races above, there is still a big gap. If you want to make a big fuss again, you must bring all the remaining races together.

Without drinking a few pounds, normal people would not have such a heaven-defying idea. Except for the Beast God himself, no one could do it.

Just after sending Zero away, Hudson received a message from the royal capital: The Kingdom of Hessen formally asked the kingdom for help, and he should quickly go to the royal capital for a meeting.

As the top figure in the military, Hudson would naturally be present at the meeting to discuss whether to send troops.

There is nothing much to say, he was born to be a hard worker. Among all the noble lords of the Alpha Kingdom, except for those who served in the capital, he was the most diligent in going to the capital.

Basically, every time something big happened, Hudson had to go to the capital. Adding routine meetings, on average Hudson went to the capital once a month.

As a result of running back and forth so frequently, he became very familiar with all the civil and military officials in the court. No matter who he met, he could chat with them, and when they walked together, they felt like family.

Fortunately, we live in a joint-stock kingdom. If we were in a unified dynasty, the censors would have swarmed in to impeach us: collusion between internal and external forces, and conspiracy to rebel!

As usual, they mixed in with the crowd and walked into the hall in groups of two or three. Hudson didn't know if it was an illusion, but he always felt that Caesar IV was deliberately staring at them.

He couldn't find the reason for the attention, so he just ignored it. Anyway, he made a living by his record, so he didn't need to look at the king's face.

Even if the king wanted to optimize the team and replace all the civil and military officials in the court, it would not be the turn of Hudson, the front-line commander, to be laid off.

Without the pressure of career, he naturally had no time to figure out Caesar IV's thoughts, let alone flattering the boss.

Frankly speaking, Hudson found that Caesar IV was also quite miserable. None of the important officials in the court were good at guessing the king's thoughts.

Everyone has their own duties, and they often embarrass the king at work. If it were a stronger king, he would at least send them back to farm, if not to kill them.

But not Caesar IV!

The court is full of veterans from two dynasties, all of whom have made great contributions. Without a suitable reason, even the king cannot make personnel adjustments.

To put it another way with low EQ: there was a serious lack of factionalism among the civil and military officials in the court, and the king's power was greatly reduced.

What's worse is that this group is made up of "loyal ministers", each with a higher reputation than the other, and no one thinks there is anything wrong with them vetoing the king's opinion!

It is difficult to find a crime to accuse them of. What these guys did was completely instinctive. In fact, they did not really form a party, nor did they think of undermining the king.

Power is so mysterious. Once you are in a position, no matter what people's subjective ideas are, the objective result is that the royal power is restricted.

If it were a constitutional monarchy, this would be the most ideal team. Unfortunately, the Alpha Kingdom is a monarchy, and Caesar IV does not have such advanced ideas.

After the polite greetings, Hudson returned to his seat and waited quietly for the meeting to begin.

...

"Prime Minister, now that everyone is here, you will be responsible for presiding over the meeting!"

Caesar IV's words did not cause any ripples at the scene. It was not uncommon for the king not to want to preside over the meeting and to leave the matter to the prime minister.

The displeasure in his tone was ignored by everyone. The king was unhappy, what did it have to do with them?

"Yes, Your Majesty!"

After a polite reply, the Prime Minister, the Grand Duke of Newfoundland, walked to the center of the hall and said slowly: "The main reason for calling everyone here today is to discuss the affairs of the Kingdom of Hessen.

There are three topics in total:

Will the kingdom send troops?

How many troops should be sent?

Who will lead the troops?"

"Prime Minister, the Kingdom's dispatch of troops is inevitable. No need to waste time discussing, let's move directly to the next two topics!"

Marquis Delgado answered first.

It can be seen that the Chancellor of the Exchequer is not in a good mood at the moment.

Before the troops move out, the food and fodder must be sent first.

If we want to send troops to rescue the Kingdom of Hessen, military expenditures are bound to be unavoidable. Perhaps we can get a more generous reward from the Hessen people, but that is a matter for the future.

Moreover, even if there are returns, they are mostly political, and the probability of them being fed back into finances is very small.

As if cursed, the Alpha Kingdom itself is a poor ghost, and the allies it finds can only be poor ghosts. Even if they are not poor ghosts now, they will become poor ghosts in the future.

For example, the neighboring Principality of Moshi was once famous for its wealth, but after forming an alliance with the Kingdom of Alpha, it quickly fell from a wealthy country to financial bankruptcy.

At least, that's what it looks like on the surface!

The finances of the three countries in the Central Continent were originally quite good, but they were caught up in this wave of chaos, and it was only a matter of time before they became impoverished countries.

"If no one objects, then let's move on to the second topic!"

The Prime Minister, the Grand Duke of Newfoundland, shrugged indifferently.

Suddenly, Hudson felt countless eyes cast towards him, and it was obvious that everyone was interested in his opinion.

"From the feedback from the Kingdom of Hessen, the main problem with the rebels is that there are too many of them, and their actual combat effectiveness is actually very average.

In terms of high-end power, the Hessians are still able to suppress the rebels, so we only need to draw out three standing legions and recruit some noble private armies.

The total number of troops should not exceed 80,000!

Otherwise, logistics coordination will be very troublesome. According to feedback from the military instructors sent out, the Hesse Kingdom's logistics reforms are not going smoothly. "

In just a few sentences, a lot of information is revealed. It turns out that there is really no free lunch in the world.

While the Hessians received support from military instructors sent by the kingdom, they also exposed their own strengths and weaknesses to the kingdom.

To put it bluntly, Hudson knew more about the military strength of the Kingdom of Hesse than Alexander V.

The ministers would deceive their king, but the military instructors they sent out had no motive to deceive their own marshal.

As bystanders, even if the Hessian Kingdom's army was a rotten mess, no one would hold them accountable.

Helping to reform the military system is just helping. If they want to learn, they can learn. If they don't want to learn, forget it. It won't affect their salary.

Relying on the instructor system extending to the front line, the analysis of the rebels' strength was also summarized in Hudson's hands.

Although this information may be delayed for some time, its essence has never changed.

The feedback from the evil god also has its limits. Being able to provide power feedback to 100 people does not mean that it can also provide power feedback to 1,000 or 10,000 people.

As the rebel forces continued to grow, the little bit of strength boosted by the evil god's external force became increasingly insignificant.

Either pursue quantity or pursue quality. The energy that the evil god can feedback is ultimately limited.

If the evil god could output unlimited power, so many evil cult organizations on the continent would not have to hide in the corners and tremble for countless years.

Chapter 238: Southern Expedition

The meeting came to a sudden stop when it came to the last topic. The main reason was that the orcs were ready to make a move and Hudson couldn't get away.

Everyone knew it was just an excuse, but no one broke it. The defense of the Near East could not be without a leader. Once Hudson led his troops south, he would have to step down as the commander-in-chief of the front.

Compared with the position of commander on the front line, helping the Kingdom of Hessen to suppress the rebellion this time is really too low-profile.

The most core issue is still: military power!

As the supreme commander on the Near East front, Hudson commanded the kingdom's most elite border troops and the private armies of the nobles in the seven provinces of the Near East. During wartime, he was also able to control the private armies of the nobles in the twelve provinces in the northern border.

In the Near East, the power was unimaginable. The fact that Hudson had to be invited to every important meeting of the kingdom was enough to illustrate the problem.

In comparison, the expeditionary force to the Kingdom of Hesse was of a much lower standard. Not only was the total force limited to 80,000, but the three standing armies sent were also second-line legions.

In non-wartime, this second-line army is usually not fully staffed, usually ranging from 5,000 to 8,000 people. The number of troops depends entirely on which army corps are drawn.

The rest were all private armies of the nobles. Although their combat effectiveness had been greatly improved after so many years of training, they were still not as good as the regular army.

Of course, the military instructors sent to the Kingdom of Hesse all believed that the combat effectiveness of the private army of the kingdom's nobles could catch up with the level of the regular army of the Kingdom of Hesse.

There is no doubt that this evaluation is biased. Although they are all private armies of the nobles of the Alpha Kingdom, the difference in combat effectiveness among them is greater than the difference between humans and dogs.

If it were Hudson's own private army, this evaluation would definitely be a bit conservative. The three elite legions in the territory are also top-notch in the kingdom's standing army.

As for the specific combat effectiveness of the private army of any small noble, it depends on the military quality of the noble lord.

Although everyone has been training frantically in recent years, there is still a gap between people.

Some people are able to train serfs into elite soldiers; while others, after training, the serfs remain serfs.

Perhaps they were stronger than ordinary serfs, but their overall level was just that, and they had never reached the threshold of elite troops.

However, no matter how weak they are, they have received military training after all, and their combat effectiveness is much stronger than that of the rebels who have just taken up arms.

If the training of the Hessian standing army was a little worse, and there were more nobles who lived a life of idleness, perhaps both sides would be on the same level.

The more he understood, the more he despised the Kingdom of Hessen. Such a rich family fortune wasted. If it weren't for the good mid- and high-end strength, this ally would be unnecessary.

To be exact, none of the three countries in the Central Continent was worthy of Hudson's attention. The three countries that were once considered as the three great powers, after digging into the inside story, were all just superficial.

Just because Hudson disdains the position of commander-in-chief of the Southern Expedition Army doesn't mean that others don't either.

All major factions in the court were eyeing the situation covetously, and the local noble lords were also ready to make a move.

These have little to do with Hudson. Now he is just a spectator.

Politics requires balance. He already controls half of the kingdom's military power. No matter what, the position of commander-in-chief of the southern expedition army will never fall into the hands of his generals.

In fact, even if everyone did not object, Hudson had no direct generals to recommend.

It has little to do with the general's personal ability, but mainly because his direct lineage's record and background are not very good. Forcing him to the position will only hurt others and himself.

Those who were able to participate in the competition must have been well-informed. They all knew that the Kingdom of Hesse was targeting the weak, so all the governors from all regions jumped out to submit petitions for battle.

They were not fighting alone this time, they also had the support of the small and medium nobles within the province. They were all eager to make a fortune in the war in the Kingdom of Hessen.

It was Hudson who started the bad precedent. Anyone with property of unknown origin was suspected of being war proceeds.

Even though he divided the spoils fairly and impartially every time, people still couldn't believe that he only gained so little.

It wasn't that they suspected him of hiding the spoils, but that they thought he was doing some private work. Every time he went out on his own, everyone thought he was taking a dragon and a bear out to do a business with no capital.

At first, Hudson wanted to explain it, but then he thought about it and realized that if he could explain this problem, then the unknown source of the huge amount of wealth would be impossible to explain.

I just let everyone misunderstand me. After all, if you take things from the enemy on the battlefield, it is legal.

Being able to grab something is a skill, but being unable to grab something will make you despised.

There were many generals who made fortunes on the battlefield, and Hudson wouldn't be a big deal. As long as the opportunity was right, no one would mind making a quick buck.

The division of spoils after a war is only a small part of the profits. Everyone's main source of income comes from the spoils gained while carrying out missions alone.

Someone has calculated for Hudson that the investment in developing the Mountain Territory and the Snow Moon Territory is as high as tens of millions of gold coins, which is definitely not the wealth that a master of alchemy can earn, nor is it something that an arms dealer can collect.

Precious family connections are used to save lives, not to be wasted. If you suffer a little injustice, people may not see it.

"boom!"

I asked you to come here today to hold a meeting, not to listen to you cursing.

If you want to curse Charles III, go to the Frankish Kingdom! No matter how harshly you curse him here, no one will hear you! "

The king suddenly lost his temper, and the ministers were also shocked. However, no one found out that the cause was themselves, and they just thought that the king was in a bad mood.

Deep down, some people still wondered if the king and the queen had quarreled again.

Ever since the prince's accident, problems have arisen in the love life of the model couple, the king and the queen.

Of course, this is the king's family affair, and no one would be stupid enough to get involved.

As for Caesar IV's proposal, everyone tacitly pretended not to hear it. It didn't matter if they were just talking nonsense on their own territory.

If you go to the Frankish Kingdom and curse Charles III, it means you are really tired of living.

"Your Majesty, there is actually nothing to discuss about Charles III's enthronement.

We must certainly condemn this act of ascending the throne despite opposition from various countries.

However, there is no need to interfere with the coalition. The Franks made great efforts in the establishment of the Five Nations Alliance, and this is a good opportunity to repay this favor.

Even if we don't participate, the outside world will understand. We don't get along with the Dawn Church. Where they are, there is no us.

The intervention coalition was organized by the Holy See, how can the Kingdom join it! "

As soon as the Prime Minister, the Grand Duke of Newfoundland, finished his words, Caesar IV became angry again.

From the perspective of the kingdom, there is nothing wrong with doing this. The Alpha Kingdom has no conflict of interest in the southern continent, so a few verbal condemnations are enough to show their attitude.

But from the king's perspective, the situation was completely different. Originally everyone was on an equal footing, but now someone suddenly wanted to jump to the front and suppress the others. How could this be tolerated?

What's worse is that when Charles III ascended the throne and proclaimed himself emperor, he also announced that he would continue the legal system of the last unified empire in human history, which was a challenge to all monarchs.

Wouldn't it be a disguised recognition that the Frankish Empire was the orthodox human race and that their kings were just restless princes if Charles III was allowed to become emperor?

Even if it is inconvenient for the kingdom to send troops, it still has to send an expeditionary force symbolically to strongly demonstrate the political stance of the Alpha Kingdom.

"Prime Minister, you are old!

There is no such thing as human relations between countries. Everything should be based on the interests of the kingdom. Why should we care about the feelings of the Franks? "

As soon as Caesar IV finished speaking, the atmosphere in the hall suddenly became tense. As a monarch, saying that a minister is old, isn't this clearly sending him home?

If other people were asked to resign, everyone would understand. The Grand Duke of Newfoundland in front of him was not an ordinary prime minister of the kingdom, but also a core member of the royal family.

It is easy to replace the Grand Duke of Newfoundland, but it is not an easy task to pick someone from the royal family to fill the vacancy.

Are we going to let Grand Duke Efiero take the throne?

This thought flashed through everyone's mind. The position of the prime minister was very important, and the position of the military minister was equally important.

It is impossible to hold both positions!

If someone holds two positions at the same time, the king will not be able to sleep. This practice of destroying the political balance is completely deliberate cultivation of powerful officials.

If Grand Duke Efiero fills the position, the vacant position of Minister of War will not be taken by an ordinary person.

At least at this moment, no member of the royal family has the prestige to hold such an important position.

If personnel adjustments are made without authorization when a suitable successor cannot be found, it would be equivalent to handing over the political resources of the royal family to others.

Even if the person promoted is the king's confidant, as long as he sits in the position, a new political group will inevitably be born.

Even if this person is loyal to the royal family, he still has to arrange his own people. It seems to be a simple replacement, but in fact it is a major earthquake that affects the political balance of the kingdom.

Hudson, who was mentally prepared, did not panic with everyone else and just acted as a spectator.

There is no family affection in front of power. Even members of the royal family cannot stand in the way of the king.

It is very regrettable that the Grand Duke of Newfoundland, who devoted his life to the kingdom, never imagined that he would so soon become a stumbling block to the king's power.

"Your Majesty is right. When people get old, they are no longer useful and cannot see things comprehensively. If that is the case, then Your Majesty should choose someone more capable and virtuous!"

After saying this, the Grand Duke of Newfoundland just walked away in anger.

"Prime Minister!"

"Prime Minister!"

...

The ministers almost instinctively tried to persuade him to stay, and this scene further strengthened Caesar IV's decision. He had been a little hesitant at first, but now he had no more reservations.

Now it is the Grand Duke of Newfoundland who left on his own initiative, which has led to such a situation. If the Grand Duke of Newfoundland pretends to be ignorant and insists on holding on to his position, he will be even more passive.

"The Grand Duke of Newfoundland has made great contributions to the kingdom. He is now old and has stepped down, but the position of Prime Minister cannot remain vacant.

Duke Efiero..."

Before he could finish his words, the Grand Duke of Efiero, who was named, interrupted him and said, "Your Majesty, I am two years older than the Grand Duke of Newfoundland!"

The earth-shattering answer shocked the court.

The former prime minister was sent back home by the king, and the new prime minister's appointment had not even been announced, but he jumped out to mess things up.

It's definitely a drama of royal infighting.

If Caesar IV had known that the situation would turn out like this, he would probably not have started by taking action against the prime minister right from the start.

Unfortunately, there is no regret medicine in politics. Once Grand Duke Efiero's words came to fruition, he was doomed to not be able to continue staying in the court, otherwise he would be slapping Caesar IV in the face.

The resignation of the two elders of the royal camp immediately broke the political balance of the court. Even though Caesar IV had made preparations in advance, he did not expect the situation to deteriorate to this point.

Without much lingering, the heartbroken Grand Duke Efiero simply waved his sleeves and strode out of the court.

There were already few people in the hall, and the two most important seats were suddenly vacant, and the atmosphere suddenly became subtle.

Everyone was waiting for Caesar IV to announce new personnel appointments, but after the lesson just now, he became hesitant.

The transfer of power also requires a transition. With the loss of two elders at once, the royal camp directly lost its leader in the court.

This is the most hardcore royalist!

The first blow he took after taking power was against his own people. Hudson didn't know how to complain.

But if you think about it carefully, there is nothing wrong with what Caesar IV did. Before this, he had discussed personnel adjustments with the prime minister, but the prime minister rejected them all.

The reasons given were extremely embarrassing: either they said that the successor had limited ability and was not as capable as the current incumbent in the court; or they angrily criticized the successor pushed forward by Caesar IV as a flatterer.

After many fruitless discussions, the Grand Duke of Newfoundland became the biggest stumbling block on Caesar IV's path to power. Without taking down the chancellor, it would be difficult to place his own people in the court.

After making concessions again and again, Caesar IV, who had accumulated a lot of resentment, finally exploded.

As a king, it was natural for him to hold power. But in his case, he almost became a high-level rubber stamp.

Although the ministers in the court respected him as the king and no one did anything to betray the emperor, when it came to state affairs, few of these "loyal ministers" gave him face.

He endured this for more than five years, but no one could understand his grievances.

He could not hold it back any longer and exploded, only to suddenly realize that he had thought too simply. Without the cooperation of the royal camp in the court, his plan was full of loopholes.

Whether Caesar IV was willing or not, the vacant positions of prime minister and minister of war had to be filled by people in the court.

It would be impossible for someone to randomly appoint a confidant to such an important position in the Alpha Kingdom.
